page.title: 08CHURCHES IN LECHLADE
page.content: The C15th.{Parish Church}of St. Lawrence stands in the centre of the town and its spire dominates the skyline. It is a busy church with Sunday and mid-week services plus youth groups, house meetings and outings. In the summer we have God's Workshop activity week for the children and cottage teas are sold each Sunday afternoon. The{Methodist Church}is almost a hundred years old. About twenty people attend Sunday services and jumble sales help raise money for the Church. A{Sunday School}has re-opened and hopes to attract more young people. The{Chapel}of the Annunciation at the Convent is a modern building and has daily services. The Chaplain, Father Bacon, is a Jesuit Priest. The Memorial Hall is also used as an American{Baptist Church.
